author: Special Correspondent
text:
CHENNAI: Police said most of the gangsters were procuring guns from Munger in Bihar.

“Gun-making is a cottage industry there. They can easily make a duplicate of any gun, including AK 47s. One just has to show the firearm to them,” said a senior police officer.

Senior officers said the gun-making industry was active in the region during the British period. “After it closed down, its employees started making guns on their own. They began by making the ‘kattas’ or country guns initially and gradually gained expertise in making sophisticated weapons,” said the officer.

The guns are then brought to the city in trains.

“Due to lack of proper checking at railways stations and bus termini, the smugglers get down at smaller stations and then deliver the guns by transporting them in buses. However, most often, the bullets fired from these guns only injure a person and do not kill them,” said a police officer.
title: Guns procured from Munger in Bihar
